gravity_system: Floating Slab, Thickened Edge, Intermediate Thickened Strip Footing
other_materials: 6x6x6 WWM, Fibre Mesh, Poly Vapour Barrier, Compacted Granular 'A', Extruded Polystyrene
key_elements: Thickened Edge, Intermediate Thickened Strip Footing
overall_building_description: The foundation system for the project at 2510 Line Road 6, Beckwith, ON, is designed as a floating slab with specific reinforcement and insulation details to ensure structural integrity and thermal efficiency. The floating slab plan, as detailed in the plan view (1/S1), measures 60 feet in length and 52 feet in width, providing a substantial base for the structure. The slab is anchored with 1/2 inch diameter anchor bolts spaced at 48 inches on center, ensuring secure attachment to the sill plate. The thickened edge detail (2/S1) incorporates a slope grade away of 2% to facilitate drainage, with optional insulation to enhance thermal performance. The sill plate is secured with 1/2 inch diameter anchor bolts at 48 inches on center, with openings left at door locations to accommodate entryways. Reinforcement within the slab includes four 15M rebar bars, with cover specifications detailed in accompanying notes, ensuring adequate tensile strength and crack control. The slab reinforcement options include 6x6x6 welded wire mesh (WWM), a 16 inch by 16 inch 10M grid, or fiber mesh, providing flexibility in reinforcement strategy based on site-specific requirements. A 6 mil poly vapor barrier is optional, offering moisture protection, while the base consists of compacted granular 'A', providing a stable foundation substrate. The section also specifies a minimum of 2 inches (R10) of extruded polystyrene with a compressive strength of 30 psi, enhancing the slab's thermal insulation properties. The intermediate thickened strip footing (3/S1) is reinforced with two continuous 15M rebar bars, providing additional structural support. This footing is also supported by compacted granular 'A' and includes a minimum of 2 inches (R10) of extruded polystyrene with a compressive strength of 30 psi, accompanied by a 6 mil poly layer, ensuring both structural and thermal performance. The detailed sections provide critical information on the load path, with the thickened edges and strip footings distributing loads evenly across the foundation, minimizing differential settlement and enhancing overall stability. The use of extruded polystyrene with a compressive strength of 30 psi ensures that the insulation can withstand the loads imposed by the structure without significant deformation. The integration of a poly vapor barrier and compacted granular 'A' further enhances the foundation's durability and resistance to moisture ingress. The design adheres to best practices in foundation engineering, with careful consideration given to load distribution, thermal performance, and moisture protection. The use of 15M rebar and 6x6x6 WWM or fiber mesh provides robust reinforcement, ensuring the slab can accommodate both static and dynamic loads. The detailed specifications for anchor bolts, rebar placement, and insulation thickness are critical for ensuring compliance with structural design codes and performance criteria. The foundation's design reflects a comprehensive approach to load path analysis, with the thickened edges and strip footings providing key load transfer points, while the floating slab distributes loads across the entire foundation area. The use of high-strength materials and precise construction details ensures that the foundation will perform effectively under the anticipated load conditions, providing a stable and durable base for the structure.
